pr_title: Add nested classes & packages to JobConfig

timeline.message: Add nested classes to Jet job.

timeline.bodyText: can we add a test with anonymous class too
timeline.author: gurbuzali

replies.bodyText: Actually, anonymous class case is not covered yet, I'm working on it right now - will do.
replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText: Could you also test with Kotlin - since Kotlin lambdas are always created as anonymous classes.
replies.author: cangencer

replies.bodyText: Do you mean actually adding kotlin as test dependency or just make sure it works with it? Adding kotlin tests might further slow down the build?
replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText: Maybe just test it for now - I don't know how complicated it would be to add it as a full dependency and some tests. It's a nice to have.
replies.author: cangencer

timeline.message: Suppress SpotBugs false positive on JDK11.

timeline.bodyText: You can simplify this by first building a literal class string (no escaping) and then calling Pattern.quote() on it.
timeline.author: mtopolnik

timeline.bodyText: minor, but Javadoc should be wrapped at 72 chars (net)
timeline.author: cangencer

timeline.bodyText: this does not work if the class is coming from a dependency. I've created a jar which contains the OuterClass and added that jar as a dependency to my project. When I called addClass, the returned resource list is empty.
timeline.author: gurbuzali

timeline.message: Accept String as package name & move ReflectionUtils to config package.
Add non-class resources together with addPackage().
Add notice about usage of classgraph.

Merge branch 'master' into job_classes

timeline.bodyText: Do we really have to double-check a @Nonnull parameter?
timeline.author: mtopolnik

timeline.bodyText: The when_<PRECONDITION>_then_<POSTCONDITION> name pattern is more useful. This name could be when_nestedClassesOf_then_returnsAllNestedClasses.
timeline.author: mtopolnik

timeline.bodyText: This should assert that the nested class is also there.
timeline.author: mtopolnik

replies.bodyText: Then we would actually test whether JVM creates nested classes in the same package as the root class which is not really the goal here.
replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText: It definitely is in the same package, and if it's not included, then addPackages is broken, going back to the place we were before this PR.
replies.author: mtopolnik

replies.bodyText: What I mean is - there are many more classes in this package, the nested class is just one of them, in the context of this test nested class is no different from the regular class, I guess to properly test it I should create a separate package with known classes in it and ensure all of them are listed, I was thinking about it but then didn't like the idea of creating yet another package... WDYT?
replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText: My thinking was explicitly look for the nested classes that you already look for in addClass.
replies.author: mtopolnik
